@brayparry @SurreyWaste @GuildfordBC @EnvAgencySE It was very simple given location of site, to have done surveillance, plus complicity between occupiers (FB operated site gates): so can reasonably assume sizeable demo projects & payments took place.

@LankesterKaren @SurreyWaste @GuildfordBC @EnvAgencySE I do find it odd that the police have not been able to track the vehicles dumping the waste. I imagine it's difficult to prove the occupiers being involved if all they are doing is living on the site but surely the police should be able to track the people actually dumping waste.

@SurreyWaste @LankesterKaren @GuildfordBC @EnvAgencySE @DanHillTV @SurreyCouncil Why should he benefit from the Council clearing waste from the site when he neglected his responsibilities and landowner for the site?

@SurreyWaste @LankesterKaren @GuildfordBC @EnvAgencySE @DanHillTV @SurreyCouncil You *cannot* own land and ignore your responsibility to what is happening on that land. If you cannot manage your land effectively to such an extent that the community's health is at risk, then you should relinquish both control *and* ownership of that land.

@SurreyWaste @LankesterKaren @GuildfordBC @EnvAgencySE @DanHillTV @SurreyCouncil Sure, that is entirely true. However securing the site is the landowner's responsibility. If the landowner is in such a position that he cannot even afford the erection of bollards on his land, as the Council, I'd be taking measures to remove his ownership of the land.

@brayparry @LankesterKaren @GuildfordBC @EnvAgencySE @DanHillTV @SurreyCouncil Surely it would‚Äôve been better for the councils to act when the landowner gave permission to drop bollards rather then spending ¬£180k so far‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..the amount of rubbish would have been far less but they did not act and now it 10x worse. The large quantity could have been prevented

@SurreyWaste @LankesterKaren @GuildfordBC @EnvAgencySE @DanHillTV @SurreyCouncil If the land is indeed the only asset he owns (and it is an asset even if it has no value), you could offer to relinquish ownership of the land to the Council for nothing since you cannot adequately manage the site. And yes, you can absolutely sell land with squatters on it.

@brayparry @LankesterKaren @GuildfordBC @EnvAgencySE @DanHillTV @SurreyCouncil He does not have any UK assets mark that is fact. Can you sell land that has squatters on it? And has been flytipped with illegal waste?

@SurreyWaste @LankesterKaren @GuildfordBC @EnvAgencySE @DanHillTV @SurreyCouncil He has UK assets including the land we are currently discussing. He could liquidate those assets to fund securing the site if he wished. At the very least, he could offer to relinquish ownership of the land to the Council, something he still could do.

@brayparry @LankesterKaren @GuildfordBC @EnvAgencySE @DanHillTV @SurreyCouncil Please confirm what legal action Daniel was supposed to have taken?
